Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Phase

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Phase
Direct Known Subclasses:
EndgamePhase, IteratedPhase, LobbyPhase, MockPhase, PhaseTest.MockPhase
public abstract class Phase extends Object
The Phase class represents a single state of the game, and it is a facade facing the controller via the Command pattern, showing the available operations (its methods), that interact with the internal state of all model entities.

The class is completely immutable. Each modifier creates a new object; for more details see subclasses.

See Also:
  • LobbyPhase
  • PreparePhase
  • PlanningPhase
  • ActionPhase
  • EndgamePhase

    • getPlayerUsernames

      public List<String> getPlayerUsernames()
      Returns a list containing all the usernames that this phase has knowledge of.
      Returns:
      a list containing all the usernames that this phase has knowledge of.

      UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported by the current phase of the game

    • getCurrentPlayer

      Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Getter for this Phase's current player. Default implementation throws exception if the phase's has not got a player.
      Returns:
      this phase's current player.

    • authorizePlayer

      public Player authorizePlayer(String username) throws InvalidPlayerException
      Checks if the player with the given username exists and has permission to modify the game state.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player to authorize
      Returns:
      a Player object
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if username is null
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported by the current phase of the game
      InvalidPlayerException - either if the specified player username is invalid or it is not the specified player's turn

    • addToIsland

      public Phase addToIsland(Player player, int index, Student student) throws InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      Add the given Student to the student store on the Island with the given index.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player who will move the Student
      index - the index of the Island
      student - the Student to add
      Returns:
      a new Phase containing the update
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if the index is out of bounds

    • getFromEntrance

      public Tuple<? extends Phase,Student> getFromEntrance(Player player, PieceColor color) throws InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      Retrieve a Student from the specified Player's entrance
      Parameters:
      player - the Player of whom board to modify
      color - the color to get from the entrance
      Returns:
      a Tuple containing a Phase with the changes applied and the Student extracted
      Throws:
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if the player's entrance doesn't have enough students of the specified color
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null

    • addToHall

      public Phase addToHall(Player player, Student student) throws InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      Add the given Student to the player's hall.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player whose Hall will be updated
      student - the Student to add
      Returns:
      a new Phase containing the update
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if the Hall cannot contain any more students of that color

    • markStudentMove

      public Phase markStudentMove(Player player) throws InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      Marks that the given Player has done one of his allowed movements.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player that has done the movements
      Returns:
      a new Phase containing the update
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException

    • chooseMageDeck

      public Phase chooseMageDeck(Player player, Mage mage) throws InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      This method lets the given Player choose the mage deck corresponding to the given enum.
      Parameters:
      player - a reference to a Player as returned by authorizePlayer
      mage - a Mage value
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported by the current phase of the game
      IllegalArgumentException - any parameter is null
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if the mage has already been chosen by another player

    • playAssistant

      public Phase playAssistant(Player player, AssistantType assistant) throws InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      This method lets the given Player play the assistant card of his deck corresponding the AssistantType passed.
      Parameters:
      player - a reference to a Player as returned by authorizePlayer
      assistant - the AssistantType to play
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported by the current phase of the game
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if this assistant has already been played by another player in this round
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if this assistant has already been played by the player

    • moveMn

      public Phase moveMn(Player player, int steps) throws InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      This method lets the given Player a movement of Mother Nature across the islands, for a total number of steps specified via parameter. The movement is performed clockwise on the islands (see game rules).
      Parameters:
      player - a reference to a Player as returned by authorizePlayer
      steps - the number of steps of the movement
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported by the current phase of the game
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if the number of steps is invalid (see game rules)

    • playCharacter

      public Phase playCharacter(Player player, CharacterType character, CharacterStep... steps) throws InvalidPhaseUpdateException, InvalidCharacterParameterException
      This method lets the given Player play a character card. The CharacterType is passed via parameter, along with all the needed additional information as a series of CharacterStep.
      Parameters:
      player - a reference to a Player as returned by authorizePlayer
      character - the CharacterType to play
      steps - additional arguments that specify the behaviour of the card (see specific card for details)
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported by the current phase of the game
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null
      InvalidCharacterParameterException - if the additional information "args" is either missing or incorrect
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if the number of coins of the player is less than the amount required to play the character card (see game rules)

    • hasPlayedCharacter

      boolean hasPlayedCharacter()
      Returns true if the current Player has already played a character during this phase. Default implementation returns false.
      Returns:
      true if the current Player has already played a character during this phase.

    • drainCloud

      public Phase drainCloud(Player player, int id) throws InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      This method lets the given Player pick a cloud from the playing area and retrieve all the students placed on it (see game rules).
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the id
      player - a reference to a Player as returned by authorizePlayer
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported by the current phase of the game
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the id does not represent a valid id
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if the specified id has already been picked this round

    • addPlayer

      public Phase addPlayer(String username) throws InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      This method lets a client join the game. It requires a username, that is from now on identifying the player inside the game. Therefore, it must not be an already chosen username for this game.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player who wants to join
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported by the current phase of the game
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given username is null
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if a player with the same username is already taking part in this game
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if the maximum number of players has already joined the game

    • removePlayer

      public Phase removePlayer(String username) throws InvalidPhaseUpdateException
      This method lets a player peacefully disconnect from the game lobby. From now on, the server will no longer keep track of this player.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the player
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this operation is not supported by the current phase of the game
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given username is null
      InvalidPhaseUpdateException - if the specified player is not taking part in this game

    • isFinal

      boolean isFinal()
      Returns true if this Phase corresponds to a "game ended" scenario.
      Returns:
      true if this Phase corresponds to a "game ended" scenario

    • getWinners

      List<Player> getWinners()
      Returns a list with all the Players that meet the winner criteria. If the list is of length greater than 1, we are in a tie situation. If the list is empty, that means that this phase isn't a final phase. To see the cases in which a Player is a winner, check the game rules.
      Returns:
      a list with all the Players that meet the winner criteria
      See Also:
      • isFinal()

    • dump

      PhaseDiff dump()
      Dumps all this Phase's information into a PhaseDiff. It is conceptually equivalent to diffing with an empty Phase.
      Returns:
      a new PhaseDiff

    • addEntityUpdateListToDiff

      private void addEntityUpdateListToDiff(PhaseDiff diff, List<? extends Jsonable> list, DiffKeys key)
      Helper method that adds a copy of the given list of Jsonable to a PhaseDiff with the given key as entity updates.
      Parameters:
      diff - the PhaseDiff
      list - the List of Jsonable
      key - a value from DiffKeys

    • addAttributeToDiff

      private void addAttributeToDiff(PhaseDiff diff, com.google.gson.JsonPrimitive primitive, DiffKeys key)
      Helper method that adds the given JsonPrimitive to a PhaseDiff with the given key as an attribute.
      Parameters:
      diff - the PhaseDiff
      primitive - the JsonPrimitive
      key - a value from DiffKeys

    • compare

      public PhaseDiff compare(Phase other)
      Calculates a PhaseDiff from this Phase and the given one. If any differences are found, the data from the argument instance is saved into the diff.

      Note: The phase's name will always be included, event if the two objects have the same one.

      Parameters:
      other - the Phase to compare against
      Returns:
      a new PhaseDiff
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null

    • calculatePlayerListDiff

      private void calculatePlayerListDiff(Phase other, PhaseDiff acc)
      Calculates the difference between the player lists and saves it inside the PhaseDiff
      Parameters:
      other - the Phase to compare to
      acc - the PhaseDiff into which to put the difference, if there is one

    • calculateCurrentPlayerDiff

      private void calculateCurrentPlayerDiff(Phase other, PhaseDiff acc)
      Calculates the difference between the current players and saves it inside the PhaseDiff. The current player is added into the diff if:
      • other has a current player but this has not
      • both instances have a current player an it is different
      Parameters:
      other - the Phase to compare to
      acc - the PhaseDiff into which to put the difference, if there is one

    • calculateProfessorDiff

      private void calculateProfessorDiff(Phase other, PhaseDiff acc)
      Calculates the difference between the professors and saves it inside the PhaseDiff
      Parameters:
      other - the Phase to compare to
      acc - the PhaseDiff into which to put the difference, if there is one

    • calculateBoardsDiff

      private void calculateBoardsDiff(Phase other, PhaseDiff acc)
      Calculates the difference between the Boards and saves it inside the PhaseDiff
      Parameters:
      other - the Phase to compare to
      acc - the PhaseDiff into which to put the difference, if there is one

    • calculateIslandListDiff

      private void calculateIslandListDiff(Phase other, PhaseDiff acc)
      Calculates the difference between the Islands and relative lists and saves it inside the PhaseDiff.

      If the two lists have different sizes, all the list is dumped along with an attribute specifying the id distribution.

      Parameters:
      other - the Phase to compare to
      acc - the PhaseDiff into which to put the difference, if there is one

    • createIslandIdArray

      private List<Jsonable> createIslandIdArray(List<Island> islandList)
      Creates the array of island ids saved in the diffs from the given list of islands
      Parameters:
      islandList - the list of islands
      Returns:
      a list of Jsonable

    • calculateIslandsDiff

      private void calculateIslandsDiff(List<Island> thisIslands, List<Island> otherIslands, PhaseDiff acc)
      Calculates the difference between the first list of Islands and the second and saves it inside the PhaseDiff.
      Parameters:
      thisIslands - first list to compare
      otherIslands - second list to compare
      acc - the PhaseDiff into which to put the difference, if there is one

      acc - the PhaseDiff into which to put the difference, if there is one

    • addCloudToArrayList

      private void addCloudToArrayList(Cloud c, ArrayList<Jsonable> js, int i)
      Adds the given cloud to the arraylist appending the index in the Jsonable
      Parameters:
      c - The Cloud to add
      js - The ArrayList to add the Cloud into
      i - The index of the Cloud
